_description: The devoted but unrequited lover, in a Latin sermon — one cross-rhymed quatrain

DurCathBI18.Transcription:
So lange ik aue lefman stonden at þe yatheþat my fote is
                    hi-frosen fast to þe stake
DurCathBI18.Note:
In the sermon by Thomas Aquinas, Summa de VII
                    viciis.

BerlinTheol.Transcription:
So longe ic haue lauediyhoued at þi gateþat mi fot is
                    ifrore lauedifor þi luue faste to þe stake
BerlinTheol.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Middle English Lyrics: Handlist of New Texts.” 
             Anglia
         83 (1965): 35-47: 47.
Bennett,  Jack Arthur Walter. 
             Middle English Literature.
Oxford History of English Literature.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1986; ed. and completed by 
                Douglas
                Gray
            : 365.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 550.
